channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 79th Malasakit Center opens in Laguna
item.description: Sen. Bong Go, chair of the committee on health and demography, attended the “virtual” launch of the country’s 79th Malasakit Center at the Laguna Medical Center in Santa Cruz. The Malasakit Center is the 40th in Luzon and sixth in Calabarzon.

item.title: Locsin backs P10 billion aid to tourism businesses, not TIEZA
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. has backed the proposal of Cagayan de Oro City Rep. Rufus Rodriguez to allocate P10 billion in the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act to the Department of Tourism itself and not to the Tourism Infrastructure and Enterprise Zone Authority.

item.title: PGH: Rapid tests not for COVID-19 screening
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Philippine General Hospital is opposed to the use of rapid antibody test in screening patients for COVID-19, saying it could not detect 80 percent of infected individuals.

item.title: DILG, DOH launch ‘BIDA ang may Disiplina’ vs COVID-19
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government and Department of Health have launched a joint discipline advocacy campaign aimed at instilling minimum health protocols in communities for a “new normal” amid the coronavirus disease pandemic.

item.title: Big Brothers told: Respect local autonomy
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Senate Minority Leader Franklin Drilon reminded yesterday Cabinet members acting as “Big Brothers” to certain local government units to observe constitutional principles on local and fiscal autonomy.

item.title: EU raises concern over death penalty revival
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The European Union has raised concern on calls to revive the death penalty in the Philippines, a beneficiary of a trade preference scheme with the EU and thus must adhere with conventions including those on human rights.

item.title: DOH eyes local Phase 3 trials for COVID-19 vaccines
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health is pushing for a “local setting” for Phase 3 of the clinical trials for the Russian-made Sputnik V vaccine for COVID-19, a DOH official said on Thursday.

item.title: Plunder raps eyed vs corrupt PhilHealth officials
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The head of the House panel investigating corruption in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. wants plunder charges filed against members of the so-called “mafia” in PhilHealth that includes officials involved in the alleged anomalies.

item.title: 79% of Pinoys say quality of life worsened in past 12 months
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Eight in 10 Filipinos believe their lives got worse in the past 12 months, according to the latest Social Weather Stations mobile phone survey.

item.title: School opening moved to October 5
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: President Duterte has approved the recommendation of the Department of Education (DepEd) to reset the opening of classes for the last time to Oct. 5 from Aug. 24.
